WorkItem.ClosedComment:
As part of our move to GitHub, we're closing our CodePlex suggestions and asking that people move them to the GitHub issue tracker for further discussion.  Some feature requests may already be active on GitHub, so please make sure to look for an existing issue before filing a new one.

You can find our GitHub issue tracker here:
https://github.com/microsoft/typeScript/issues
WorkItem.Description: I don't want VS to compile my TS, I use a grunt task to do so.  Previously when I unchecked the Compile on Save option in the VS Options dialog, this worked as expected.  I've unchecked this in VS 2013 with TS 1.0, and it seems to have no effect - all TS files are individually compiled when they're saved.
WorkItem.Summary: VS 2013 Compile on Save option can't be disabled

Comments.Message: Presumably you mean you have some .ts files in a project that are still being compiled on save. The Visual Studio option states that it only affects the behavior of files not in the current project. We could potentially add an option to disable it there as well.
